main event: On September 28, 1958, in Bristol, Tennessee, a ground-visual observation was made of a round object, initially the size of a pea, that broke into several pieces and created a long trail in the sky before appearing to burn out instantly.
interesting points: The object was first the size of a pea and then broke into several pieces, leaving a long trail in the sky before burning out.
The conclusion of the observation was that it was possibly a balloon, aircraft, or astronomical object due to insufficient data for evaluation.
The observation took place at the airport control tower at TriCity Airport near Bristol, Tennessee, and was also witnessed by the highway patrol in Bristol.
The report includes identifying information of civilian observers from TriCity Airport and the highway patrol in Bristol, Tennessee, and mentions the absence of military observers.

The description of the object led to the conclusion that it appeared to have been a meteor, based on the reporting individual's expression that it was exceptionally bright and remained in view for a long time.
result: Possibly balloon, aircraft, or astronomical object
sighted object: Round object breaking into pieces with a long trail in the sky
